semantic_title: 7th Character for Fetus Identification in Multiple Gestations
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > a. General Rules for Obstetric Cases > 6) 7th character for fetus identification

content.full_text: Where applicable, a 7th character is to be assigned for certain categories (O31, O32, O33.3 - O33.6, O35, O36, O40, O41, O60.1, O60.2, O64, and O69) to identify the fetus for which the complication code applies. Assign 7th character '0': • For single gestations • When the documentation in the record is insufficient to determine the fetus affected and it is not possible to obtain clarification. • When it is not possible to clinically determine which fetus is affected. (Evidence: pg no: 64, L36-L42)
content.summary: Guidelines for assigning 7th character to identify specific fetus in multiple gestation complications (Evidence: pg no: 64, L36-L42)
key_concepts: Fetus identification in specific categories (Evidence: pg no: 64, L37-L38)
7th character assignment rules (Evidence: pg no: 64, L38-L42)
Single gestation coding (Evidence: pg no: 64, L40)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign 7th character for fetus identification in specified categories (Evidence: pg no: 64, L37-L38)
detailed_rules.explanation: Categories O31, O32, O33.3-O33.6, O35, O36, O40, O41, O60.1, O60.2, O64, and O69 require 7th character to identify affected fetus (Evidence: pg no: 64, L37-L38)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use 7th character '0' for single gestations (Evidence: pg no: 64, L40)
detailed_rules.explanation: Single pregnancies always use 7th character '0' since there is only one fetus (Evidence: pg no: 64, L40)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use 7th character '0' when fetus cannot be determined (Evidence: pg no: 64, L41-L42)
detailed_rules.explanation: When documentation is insufficient or clinical determination impossible, use '0' (Evidence: pg no: 64, L41-L42)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify if code is from specified categories requiring 7th character
Step 2: Determine if pregnancy is single or multiple gestation
Step 4: For multiple gestations, identify affected fetus or use '0' if undetermined

code_ranges.description: Complications specific to multiple gestation (Evidence: pg no: 64, L38)
usage_rules: Use '0' for single gestations (Evidence: pg no: 64, L40)

code_ranges.description: Maternal care for malpresentation of fetus (Evidence: pg no: 64, L38)
usage_rules: Use '0' for single gestations (Evidence: pg no: 64, L40)

code_ranges.description: Maternal care for disproportion (Evidence: pg no: 64, L38)
usage_rules: Use '0' for single gestations (Evidence: pg no: 64, L40)

code_ranges.description: Maternal care for known or suspected fetal abnormality (Evidence: pg no: 64, L38)
usage_rules: Use '0' for single gestations (Evidence: pg no: 64, L40)

code_ranges.description: Maternal care for other fetal problems (Evidence: pg no: 64, L38)
usage_rules: Use '0' for single gestations (Evidence: pg no: 64, L40)

code_patterns.description: 7th character '0' for single gestations or undetermined fetus (Evidence: pg no: 64, L39-L42)
code_patterns.explanation: Final character '0' indicates single gestation or fetus cannot be determined

coding_scenarios.scenario: Twin pregnancy with fetal growth restriction affecting twin A
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Twin gestation at 32 weeks, Twin A showing intrauterine growth restriction
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify code O36.5932 (maternal care for intrauterine growth restriction, third trimester)
Step 2: Recognize this is category O36 requiring 7th character
Step 3: Assign 7th character '1' for first fetus (Twin A)

correct_coding.rationale: 7th character '1' identifies first fetus in multiple gestation (Evidence: pg no: 64, L37-L38)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Character '0' would be incorrect when specific fetus is identified
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using '0' when fetus can be specifically identified

warnings: Only specific categories require 7th character for fetus identification (Evidence: pg no: 64, L37-L38)
best_practices: Always use '0' for single gestations (Evidence: pg no: 64, L40)
Identify specific fetus when documented in multiple gestations
common_mistakes: Forgetting to assign 7th character in required categories
Using specific fetus character for single gestations
tips: Check if category requires 7th character before coding
Review ultrasound reports for fetus identification
implementation_notes: Requires knowledge of which categories need 7th character
